greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Denominator of Bernoulli(2n,1/2).
comment: From the von Staudt-Clausen theorem it follows that a(n) can be computed without using Bernoulli polynomials or the 'denominator'-function (see the Sage implementation). - _Peter Luschny_, Mar 24 2014
reference: J. R. Philip, The symmetrical Euler-Maclaurin summation formula, Math. Sci., 6, 1981, pp. 35-41.
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..250
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, von Staudt-Clausen Theorem.
Index entries for sequences related to Bernoulli numbers.
formula: a(n) = A081294(n) * A002445(n) for n > 0. - _Paul Curtz_, Apr 17 2013
Apparently, denominators of the fractions with e.g.f. (x/2) / sinh(x/2). - _Tom Copeland_, Sep 17 2016
mathematica: a[ n_] := If[ n < 0, 0, (2 n)! SeriesCoefficient[ x/2 / Sinh[x/2], {x, 0, 2 n}] // Denominator]; (* _Michael Somos_, Sep 21 2016 *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
